intro: Ocalia betulina, commonly known as the birchleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, woodland areas. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ocalia betulina is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments and has some medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
